blocks.text: The Xiegu X5105 is an HF+50MHz all-mode 5W portable transceiver with an extremely compact size (168x93x47mm). It integrates all functions required for shortwave amateur radio in a truly portable package with a 3.6-inch large lattice LCD display.

Press the power button for one second to turn on or off. The T/R indicator shows green when receiving, red when transmitting. The DATA indicator flickers during data communication, and the LINK indicator lights when connected to peripherals.
Press MODE to cycle through modes: LSB - USB - CW - CWR - NFM - AM. Press MENU to switch between multi-function menu pages. The four multi-function buttons correspond to on-screen functions.
Features include digital noise reduction (NR), digital notch, digital filter, direct decoding of amateur data modes, CW automatic calling unit, and built-in high-stability TCXO.
Press MENU to switch between displayed multi-function menus. Press the corresponding button to activate each function. Some functions require pressing SAVE after adjustment.

blocks.name: V/M
blocks.description: Switch between VFO mode and MEMO (channel memory) mode.

blocks.name: A/B
blocks.description: Switch between VFOA and VFOB for split operation or quick frequency comparison.

blocks.name: MW (Memory Write)
blocks.description: Store the current frequency and settings to a memory channel.

blocks.name: < and > Buttons
blocks.description: Move the current frequency step position left or right, changing the tuning rate.

blocks.name: TAG
blocks.description: Add an alphanumeric tag/label to a memory channel.

blocks.name: CSN (Call Sign)
blocks.description: Set your call sign for display on startup.

blocks.text: The KEY interface is a 3.5mm stereo socket for manual or automatic keys. For a manual key, connect 'di' and 'da' together.
CW AUTO transmission allows automatic sending of preset messages. The CW automatic calling unit can store and transmit common exchanges.
The X5105 supports both manual button and automatic button mode switching for flexible operation.
The digital baseband enables advanced features including digital noise reduction (NR), digital NOTCH filter for removing interference, and adjustable digital filtering (AFF - Audio Filter Function).
The modem function (MDN) enables direct decoding of amateur data modes. With external adapters, data communication can be done directly without a PC or separate modem.
The X5105 features a built-in large-capacity lithium battery pack (3800mAh @ 12V) and also accepts external DC power. The wide working voltage range adds flexibility for various power sources.
External DC power must provide 13.8V @ 3A minimum. Use the supplied power cable to connect - observe the interface definitions on the left panel.
The DC power interface also serves as the internal battery charging port. Retract the side guards after use to protect the interfaces.
Press ATU briefly to connect the automatic antenna tuner to the antenna interface. Long press ATU to initiate automatic tuning.
The Standing Wave Ratio Scanner (SWR) function allows you to scan and visualize antenna performance across frequencies, helping with antenna adjustment and troubleshooting.

blocks.name: Controls not responding
blocks.description: Press LOCK to check if controls are locked. Short press unlocks all buttons and knobs.

blocks.name: No display backlight
blocks.description: Long press LOCK for 1 second to toggle the screen backlight on/off.

blocks.name: Factory reset
blocks.description: Use the Reset function in system parameters to restore default settings if configuration becomes problematic.

blocks.name: Data mode setup
blocks.description: Connect computer via ACC interface for audio and COM interface for CAT control. See manual for XPA125 amplifier and CE-19 expansion card connections.
